title: Police: Child injured in drive-by related to Kendall Foster
content:
DES MOINES, Iowa —
Authorities have released new information in a drive-by shooting that left a 12-year-old girl injured.
The Des Moines Police Department has identified the child as a family member of Kendall Foster, a 17-year-old Des Moines teen who was shot and killed in April.
The girl was shot in the neck Sunday afternoon while sitting in her living room, according to police.
The girl’s name is not being released due to her age.
Officers were sent to the 3100 block of Fifth Avenue near Riverview Park around 4:15 p.m. on reports of a drive-by shooting. When they arrived, they found the victim, an 11-year-old girl, who was taken to a nearby hospital. The extent of the girl’s injuries is unknown.
“I heard gunshots and didn’t really think much about it at first,” one neighbor told KCCI. I grew up over here, so I’ve heard it a lot, but having it happen right down the block was kind of interesting.”
According to the police report, video taken at the time of the shooting shows an occupant in a white-colored Mercury Sable fired six shots at the house.
No suspects have been arrested, and the case remains under investigation.
Check back with KCCI-TV, kcci.com or our mobile app for more on this
